author: Rollo_Tomassi
title: Utility Vehicle
review: For some  reason I had two of these as a child, and it was a great little utility vehicle to drive "supplies" from one base over to another with all my little Minifigs.  The hightlight is definitely back half of the vehicle with the compartment, and the hooks for tool.   The front part is just the steering wheel, which is kinda boring. A few more bricks up front would have livened ths one up considerably, but for its size and brickcount it's a decent rig.

author: jafo654
title: My first Lego set
review:
This was My first lego set. I remember driving it all over the house imagining I was driving on the Moon. Lots of fun.

Box/Instructions

Like all legos easy to understand.

Parts

This set was small and easy to keep track of. I do not think it needed more than it had. Sometimes the simple sets where more fun to play with. Just use your imagination and you can go anywhere with this little guy.

Minifigures

One is all you need with a small set.

The build

Real easy to build.

The completed model

Cute and fun.

Overall opinion

Loved this set still have it.

author: Explorer6890
title: Minimalist functional space buggy
review:
It comes with the new yellow spaceman introduced in 1982 and 1983 space balloon tyres -- finally something more realistic which differentiated a space buggy from a town vehicle!

It has a complete set of play functions for a vehicle this size -- hinged chassis for going on rough terrain, a detachable hand-held metal detector, a locker (actually a grey town letterbox) to store samples and an aerial which can be raised and lowered.
